context: I was judgmental about your life choices
letters:
Dear [Friend's Name],

I hope this note finds you well. I have been reflecting on our recent conversations, and I feel I need to reach out and express my sincerest apologies.

I realize that my comments about your life choices were judgmental and insensitive. It was never my intention to make you feel uncomfortable or undervalued. I now see that my words came from a place of misunderstanding rather than support, and for that, I am truly sorry.

Your journey is unique to you, and it’s filled with experiences that have shaped who you are. I deeply regret not recognizing that sooner and for not being the friend you deserve. I admire your courage to make choices that resonate with you, and I appreciate the trust you place in me to share your life.

Please know that I am committed to being more understanding and supportive moving forward. I value our friendship dearly and hope that we can move past this misunderstanding. If you’re open to it, I would love to talk more about this and hear your feelings.

Thank you for your patience and understanding. I am lucky to have you in my life, and I want to be a better friend.

Warmly,  
[Your Name]
